thread.title: Leonardo DiCaprio Gala in St. Tropez Features the Most Amazing Celebrity Auction of All Time
thread.title_full: Leonardo DiCaprio Gala in St. Tropez Features the Most Amazing Celebrity Auction of All Time - Forbes

author: Jim Dobson
title: Leonardo DiCaprio Gala in St. Tropez Features the Most Amazing Celebrity Auction of All Time
text:
(AP Photo/Francois Mori)
In what is easily one of the most outrageous celebrity auctions of all time, the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation is having its Second Annual Gala in St. Tropez on July 22 at a private villa.
Hosted by Leonard DiCaprio, HSH Albert II Prince of Monaco, Giorgio Armani, Boris F.J. Collardi, Marion Cotillard, Philippe Cousteau, Tom Hardy, Kate Hudson, Sir Elton John and David Furnish and Caroline Scheufele, the event also features a live performance by John Legend and surprise performances (Bono and Robin Thicke performed last year.)
Among the amazing items being offered are; Private concert with Elton John, a villa at DiCaprio’s new island, a 61 Chevy Roadster, an Arctic Expedition with Prince Albert and many more featured below.
Founded in 1998, the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation (LDF) works to protect the Earth’s last wild places by implementing solutions that restore balance to threatened ecosystems, and ensuring the long-term health and wellbeing of all its inhabitants.
LDF, through partnerships and direct grant commitments, brings attention and needed funding to three areas:protecting biodiversity, ocean & forest conservation and climate change. To execute its programming,the Foundation works in close collaboration with a broad network of stakeholders including environmental leaders and experts, local communities, national and international leaders, effective organizations and committed philanthropists.
With strategic investments in 70 cutting-edge conservation, climate change, public advocacy and environmental protection projects, LDF is making meaningful progress toward resolving environmental threats and creating a more harmonious relationship between humanity and nature in more than 40 countries and in all five of the world’s oceans.
For more information visit: www.leonardodicaprio.org
For advance bids email LDF@aabproductions.com
